Files

influxdb/integrations/serde_integration/
mod.rs

1//! Serde Integration for InfluxDB. Provides deserialization of query returns.
2//!
3//! When querying multiple series in the same query (e.g. with a regex query), it might be desirable to flat map
4//! the resulting series into a single `Vec` like so. The example assumes, that there are weather readings in multiple
5//! series named `weather_<city_name>` (e.g. `weather_berlin`, or `weather_london`). Since we're using a Regex query,
6//! we don't actually know which series will be returned. To assign the city name to the series, we can use the series
7//! `name`, InfluxDB provides alongside query results.
8//!
9//! ```rust,no_run
10//! use influxdb::{Client, Query};
11//! use serde::Deserialize;
12//!
13//! #[derive(Deserialize)]
14//! struct WeatherWithoutCityName {
15//!     temperature: i32,
16//! }
17//!
18//! #[derive(Deserialize)]
19//! struct Weather {
20//!     city_name: String,
21//!     weather: WeatherWithoutCityName,
22//! }
23//!
24//! # #[async_std::main]
25//! # async fn main() -> Result<(), influxdb::Error> {
26//! let client = Client::new("http://localhost:8086", "test");
27//! let query = Query::raw_read_query(
28//!     "SELECT temperature FROM /weather_[a-z]*$/ WHERE time > now() - 1m ORDER BY DESC",
29//! );
30//! let mut db_result = client.json_query(query).await?;
31//! let _result = db_result
32//!     .deserialize_next::<WeatherWithoutCityName>()?
33//!     .series
34//!     .into_iter()
35//!     .map(|mut city_series| {
36//!         let city_name =
37//!             city_series.name.split("_").collect::<Vec<&str>>().remove(2);
38//!         Weather {
39//!             weather: city_series.values.remove(0),
40//!             city_name: city_name.to_string(),
41//!         }
42//!     })
43//!     .collect::<Vec<Weather>>();
44//! # Ok(())
45//! # }
46//! ```
47
48mod de;
49
50use serde::{de::DeserializeOwned, Deserialize};
51
52use crate::{client::check_status, Client, Error, Query, ReadQuery};
53
54#[derive(Deserialize)]
55#[doc(hidden)]
56struct _DatabaseError {
57    error: String,
58}
59
60#[derive(Deserialize, Debug)]
61#[doc(hidden)]
62pub struct DatabaseQueryResult {
63    pub results: Vec<serde_json::Value>,
64}
65
66impl DatabaseQueryResult {
67    pub fn deserialize_next<T: 'static>(&mut self) -> Result<Return<T>, Error>
68    where
69        T: DeserializeOwned + Send,
70    {
71        serde_json::from_value::<Return<T>>(self.results.remove(0)).map_err(|err| {
72            Error::DeserializationError {
73                error: format!("could not deserialize: {}", err),
74            }
75        })
76    }
77
78    pub fn deserialize_next_tagged<TAG, T: 'static>(
79        &mut self,
80    ) -> Result<TaggedReturn<TAG, T>, Error>
81    where
82        TAG: DeserializeOwned + Send,
83        T: DeserializeOwned + Send,
84    {
85        serde_json::from_value::<TaggedReturn<TAG, T>>(self.results.remove(0)).map_err(|err| {
86            Error::DeserializationError {
87                error: format!("could not deserialize: {}", err),
88            }
89        })
90    }
91}
92
93#[derive(Deserialize, Debug)]
94#[doc(hidden)]
95pub struct Return<T> {
96    #[serde(default = "Vec::new")]
97    pub series: Vec<Series<T>>,
98}
99
100#[derive(Debug)]
101/// Represents a returned series from InfluxDB
102pub struct Series<T> {
103    pub name: String,
104    pub values: Vec<T>,
105}
106
107#[derive(Deserialize, Debug)]
108#[doc(hidden)]
109pub struct TaggedReturn<TAG, T> {
110    #[serde(default = "Vec::new")]
111    pub series: Vec<TaggedSeries<TAG, T>>,
112}
113
114#[derive(Debug)]
115/// Represents a returned series from InfluxDB
116pub struct TaggedSeries<TAG, T> {
117    pub name: String,
118    pub tags: TAG,
119    pub values: Vec<T>,
120}
121
122impl Client {
123    pub async fn json_query(&self, q: ReadQuery) -> Result<DatabaseQueryResult, Error> {
124        let query = q.build().map_err(|err| Error::InvalidQueryError {
125            error: format!("{}", err),
126        })?;
127
128        let read_query = query.get();
129        let read_query_lower = read_query.to_lowercase();
130
131        if !read_query_lower.contains("select") && !read_query_lower.contains("show") {
132            let error = Error::InvalidQueryError {
133                error: String::from(
134                    "Only SELECT and SHOW queries supported with JSON deserialization",
135                ),
136            };
137            return Err(error);
138        }
139
140        let url = &format!("{}/query", &self.url);
141        let mut parameters = self.parameters.as_ref().clone();
142        parameters.insert("q", read_query);
143        let mut request_builder = self.client.get(url);
144        if let Some(ref token) = self.token {
145            request_builder = request_builder.header("Authorization", format!("Token {}", token))
146        }
147        let request_builder = request_builder.query(&parameters);
148
149        #[cfg(feature = "surf")]
150        let request_builder = request_builder.map_err(|err| Error::UrlConstructionError {
151            error: err.to_string(),
152        })?;
153
154        let res = request_builder
155            .send()
156            .await
157            .map_err(|err| Error::ConnectionError {
158                error: err.to_string(),
159            })?;
160        check_status(&res)?;
161
162        #[cfg(feature = "reqwest")]
163        let body = res.bytes();
164        #[cfg(feature = "surf")]
165        let mut res = res;
166        #[cfg(feature = "surf")]
167        let body = res.body_bytes();
168
169        let body = body.await.map_err(|err| Error::ProtocolError {
170            error: err.to_string(),
171        })?;
172
173        // Try parsing InfluxDBs { "error": "error message here" }
174        if let Ok(error) = serde_json::from_slice::<_DatabaseError>(&body) {
175            return Err(Error::DatabaseError { error: error.error });
176        }
177
178        // Json has another structure, let's try actually parsing it to the type we're deserializing
179        serde_json::from_slice::<DatabaseQueryResult>(&body).map_err(|err| {
180            Error::DeserializationError {
181                error: format!("serde error: {}", err),
182            }
183        })
184    }
185}
